intro: Epilobium melanocaulon, commonly known as blackstem willow herb, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, often calcareous soils. The plant features slender, often hairy stems and produces small, pink to purple flowers in clusters. Its leaves are alternate and lance-shaped, with a rough texture. Epilobium melanocaulon is often found in wet meadows, riverbanks, and other damp habitats.
